jobDescription: GSN Games, the leading developer in mobile and social games, is seeking a Senior Manager, Live Ops with a passion for creating player excitement and engagement through events, community and player dynamics - and measuring that excitement with data - to join our casual games studio based in Palo Alto and San Francisco. About the GSN Casual Games Studio: Our studio consists of a talented group of game artists, designers, engineers, product people and marketers who craft industry-leading mobile games providing very high quality experiences. This studio is the home of Solitaire Tripeaks by GSN, the #1 revenue solitaire game on mobile that has quickly grown into one of the top grossing games on both iOS and Android. What You’ll Do: As the leader of our Live Ops team, you’ll ultimately be responsible for a happy, healthy, active and engaged player base.  You’ll be responsible for expanding and managing a strategy of player engagement, managing our events, community tools, player services, and any other dynamics you can develop. You’ll provide the focus, processes and market knowledge to ensure that our methods of player engagement are effective, contributing to both our studio success and the long-term health of our players.  You’ll work with our killer Live Ops people (including Events, Community Management and Player Services) to optimize their work and stay on strategy. You’ll also work with Design and Marketing to develop new ideas and projects; Engineering to execute those projects; and Analytics to build tools to better understand how to quickly and dynamically shape our Live offerings to provide features of most interest to our players. You coordinate closely with Performance Marketing to deliver a great continuous live environment for players, while providing a framework for ongoing learning about the best ways to engage and communicate with them. This is a unique opportunity to join a highly functioning team and take it to the next level through developing and driving strategic direction, and continually evaluating and revising it in a culture of learning.  Our ideal candidate brings extensive experience in F2P Live Ops, is comfortable working at a hands-on level, knows how to manage awesome people, and can work with data and people to prioritize A+ priorities vs B- priorities. You use your experience to set the right goals, communicate clearly and make sure the team is going the right direction, rather than figuring out how to extract that last dollar from players. You know how to use your instincts to get to the best jumping-off point, but you embrace data that tells you what’s *really* effective. You want to learn from people on your team as much as you want to teach them. You realize that we’re just at the start of this road, and know that there are great new ideas of player engagement just waiting to be developed. Responsibilities include:Provide strategic direction and day-to- day management of our player communication and engagement channelsBuild plans (and forecast/justify them) for developing new ways to
